website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus Tough TG-850 is a tough camera with a wide-angle lens that is a fine choice for photographers on a budget.

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing! Took perfect underwater photos
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! Took perfect underwater photos, still photos, moving photos, etc. Taking a selfie is super easy too with the flip screen. Make sure to soak for 10 minutes in fresh water after use in salt water. Put the camera on underwater setting for the best water photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jarvinen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money!
customer_reviews.text: The first time that I used this camera, snorkeling, it failed. It didn't get flood, just stop working. I contacted olympus and they told me that the camera was defective. I sent it back and they repaired without cost, but I paid for the shipping. After 3 months of little use, I was taking some shoots in my home and it stops working, again, for no reason. I'm tired of all the hustle this piece of trash have caused. This is not the only product of this brand that have failed. I'm disappointed with Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: rafael quiroz

customer_reviews.title: Olympus Stylus TG-850
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera that has become my go to point and shoot. Very flexible in terms of the controls plus the water proof design. I used it while snorkeling with poor results. I should have overridden the flash control. Because I did not I ended up with photos that were "snowed" by bubbles in the water. My mistake, but certainly overcomable. My other above water photos have excellent - clear and sharp with rich colors. I couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera I bought it before going to Hawaii. Movies were clear worked for Snorkeling and underwater shoots. I didn't take it diving because its rated to around 30 feet. I would have bought and may still buy the newer version That I can take down to over 50 feet and has a lot more bells and whistles!!!!!!!!! Its also an Olympus. It was to come on line I believe 6/6/2014 ,but it was also $100 more. I didn't have the time to wait. For the price this camera preformed well. the only draw back was how much more I could have gotten if I had spent $100. more and had the time to wait for the newer model.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Brandenburger

customer_reviews.title: Great for stills, some video issues
customer_reviews.text: Solid, although heavy, camera. Zoom is very quick, cameras in high to moderate light are clear and crisp. Downside is that if you're taking video the device will not re-calculate exposure. Not idea when moving from sunny shots to darker conditions. The speed of the shutter (in sport mode) and the very quick zoom make up for the video issue. Better than the 860 in my mind.
customer_reviews.author: mg858

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this 21 mm camera--the widest angle I found ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this model this October. Received it well packed with all accessories as advertised. I had a Kodak with 28 mm lens; I ordered this especially since I was not able to take sufficiently wide-angel shots. I am happy with this 21 mm camera--the widest angle I found among all he compact cameras and reasonably priced too. A special bonus was the swivel lcd screen--I could take shots from eye level to ground level, even above the head.
customer_reviews.author: minocher Engineer

customer_reviews.title: The best Waterproof Camera for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheaper, non-wifi version, of this camera and it is a perfect replacement for my older Olympus waterproof camera. Shoots excellent photos and video and the selfie screen is pretty handy. I do miss the older screen covers that used to be on these cameras but I will keep my review at 5 stars until the lens gets scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Pakmann2k

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is really good. Got this to replace the Pentax optio wg-2 ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't yet used the camera during a snorkel session. The ultimate challenge will be the keys on jam 16. Picture quality is really good. Got this to replace the Pentax optio wg-2 that got flooded due to a cleaning oversight on my part. Like the fact that there is only one access panel to worry about. Also the battery is interchangeable with my old optio and a Sony cybershot that I used to have. What would make this camera the perfect one would be to add infrared features to it so it can be used in the dark during my nighttime sea turtle rescues.
customer_reviews.author: william d west

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I got it last year for Christmas and took it to the Bahamas in May and it worked wonders on land and in the water. I had read some terrible reviews that it leaked and I was wary of that, even bringing an extra land camera just in case, but I just followed the directions, soaking it after every salt water adventure, and it never did! It's an excellent camera and I'm glad that I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Robinson

customer_reviews.title: It really is tough :)
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I took this to Hawaii and it was perfect! We used it on hikes, underwater when we went snorkeling with dolphins, and to take lots of selfies (of course). I even dropped in on one of our volcano hikes and saw nary a scratch on it. This is a great camera for someone with an active lifestyle who doesn't want to give up their firstborn for a rugged camera.
customer_reviews.author: InTheLou

customer_reviews.title: Water in lens
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera in June 2014 and within one year I have had to send the camera back to Olympus 3 times for repair. The problem is that I end up getting water in the flip screen which eventually ends up in the lens. There was a recall for some of these cameras, but after several repairs I continue to have the same issue. The only reason I gave it 2 stars in the review is because the flip screen feature is useful when it works, but overall this camera has some serious flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT little camera
customer_reviews.text: GREAT little camera. Used on a 3wk trip to Spain/France. Panorama is wonderful. Very wide lens, which will distort some architectural photos, but for documentation, is great. Quick shutter response, for multiple shots. Excellent in low light. Good depth of field. Handy size.
customer_reviews.author: Landed Lady

customer_reviews.title: This is the best camera ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera ever. You can hold it half in and half out of water for incredible shots! And at an incredible price for the quality of pictures. I love the panoramic pan ability! So many features, you would expect this to cost much more!
customer_reviews.author: T. Hanks

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera and takes good underwater pictures
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera and takes good underwater pictures. Only problem I had was with the directions on how to put the battery in the camera. It would be better to say match the three contacts with the three contacts you can see looking down in the camera.
customer_reviews.author: JohnL

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say that after using it for one day ...
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say that after using it for one day it stopped working😩 Even though I recharged it the whole night... Tried turning the knob to change the setting... it stays at the same setting
customer_reviews.author: awesome game!

customer_reviews.title: A perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: I personally don't know what the cameras like. It looks nice and when I read about it sounds great. It was a gift for a friend. All I can honestly tell you is that they are very happy with the camera. Sorry I wish I could be more help .
customer_reviews.author: brent flores

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things about it.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this tough little point-and-shoot camera. I love how I can go from a wide angle to a macro to a super macro with a simple turn of a dial. I've dropped it a few times and it's still ticking just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Took excellent pictures though the night-time modes could definitely be better
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. It's very durable, and survived a trip through the white water and sand of the Grand Canyon. Took excellent pictures though the night-time modes could definitely be better. The screen that flips up to allow easy selfies is a very nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G.

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I've taking it surfing, skiing, mountain climbing and to my daughters pre k graduation. Battery lasts much longer than most "wearable" camera, and better photo and video quality.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Great Canera
customer_reviews.text: Best point and shoot I ever had. The underwater photos are incredible. Had an issue on the camera, and to Olympus and came back like new.
customer_reviews.author: esossai

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our honeymoon and it worked great. It was easy to take high quality photos with the autofocus. The art filters can be fun, but since theycan be too much at times I suggest getting regular photos too. This is my third Olympus camera and all have lived up to their waterproof and shockproof promises.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Tencent

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, I reach for it more now than i do for my DSLR. Takes excellent photos both in and out of the water and holds up well if you live a very active or rugged lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley G. Bethel

customer_reviews.title: Photo quality poor!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with photo quality. The (old) TG-612 I currently use and was planning to replace with the TG-850 shots better quality photos. Originally purchased camera because of its features, but ultimately was not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: A few days into my trip to Mexico this camera got stuck on progra auto mode. None of the buttons except power and shoot worked. Exchanged the camera for a new one and within a half hour the same thing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Lasted 10 days in the carribean ocean ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Lasted 10 days in the carribean ocean without incident. Took great pictures in the forest, beach, and ocean. Would recommend to my friends and family
customer_reviews.author: Highlander

customer_reviews.title: great under water camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera works great under water and outside. If you're looking for an indoor camera it might not be the best choice. I took this on my vacation to puerto rico and I got some awesome pictures. The flip screen is also pretty awesome. I took the camera on an all day snorkeling trip and it lasted thd whole day. Would definitely recommend for anyone snorkeling.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie  Baker

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Used the camera for our caribbean cruise. Took some very nice underwater photos. Very happy with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: J2911

customer_reviews.title: This camera is amazing for it's size
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing for it's size. The zoom lens takes fantastic clear pictures, action shots are clear. I would definitely recommend this camera
customer_reviews.author: Tarce

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to the old models.
customer_reviews.text: Had the same problem as many others, most of the buttons stopped working after 15 minutes in the water. Had a great experience with an older model of this camera so I had high hopes. Returning it and looking elsewhere for a camera.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! I bought this as a second Olympus for my daughter. Loved this camera so much, couldn't think of getting her anything else. It's a great point and shoot, easy to use, so durable, nice images. Very happy with the camera! Bought this one refurbished and everything seems to work perfectly, would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Land or Sea - this is the camera for me!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE this camera! took wonderful shots both in and out of the water while vacationing in Atlantis. Really like the flip up viewer - fun for selfies!
customer_reviews.author: Royce Hansman

customer_reviews.title: I had the older model of this camera and liked that one better
customer_reviews.text: I had the older model of this camera and liked that one better. This one seems a little bulky and heavy by comparison. It performs just fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Waterproofed
customer_reviews.text: It does the job it is advertised for. I wish it had a manual setting so I could choose my own setting. It will take some practice to get a sharp shot underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo Bob

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations. Solid door lock, though I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Meets expectations. Solid door lock, though I have not yet tested it underwater. Logical operating system. The main drawback is image quality. Though I knew about that before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: ValhallaSystems

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera for rainy days
customer_reviews.text: Been doused with water a few times and used in a pool once. Perfect camera for rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: Don S. Satow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Great price. I had a a similar camera that I paid much more for, but this model is easier to use, has more functions and the pictures are much better!
customer_reviews.author: Lisagirl57

customer_reviews.title: Macro Option is Very Very Close
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for its fast macro focusing time. Because it is a water-resistant camera, unlocking the cover lock, then popping down the cover latch to remove the memory card gets tedious. Not an issue for me due to never taking it under water. The Art function really adds color to normal food images. Light pink tuna sashimi meat appeared as a deeper pink hue, green vegetables appeared deeper green. The Macro function only focuses when the lens is placed super close to the subject, from 2 inches away to almost touching, very very close. From a distance of 12 inches, the macro function flops around like a fish trying to focus on the air in front of it.
customer_reviews.author: DC Beginner

customer_reviews.title: 5th day all buttons except power & shutter stopped working properly
customer_reviews.text: Same problem many others seem to be having. Sometimes none of the buttons work. Sometimes it will act as if you clicked one button or turned the dial when you were clicking a different button. It took nice photos and video while it lasted. The procedure for opening it after being in water is a pain. Battery was showing as half charged after only an hour of use so I needed to charge it daily. Why don't the manufacturers of these cameras use wireless charging so you don't need to get inside the camera in order to charge??
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous camera for underwater photos - great for night photos too (land based).
customer_reviews.author: Lezli P

customer_reviews.title: happy with this
customer_reviews.text: great camera for price, dropped it once and it still works perfect
customer_reviews.author: NatalieAtoms

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about six months. Besides the quality of the pictures underwater is not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Khalems

customer_reviews.title: image quality is best for digital display
customer_reviews.text: no manual control for shutter or aperture, image quality is best for digital display, battery life short, other features perform well. Bought it for a rafting trip and it will do fine for my Facebook postings of images.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph  Liftik

customer_reviews.title: Be warned. Leaks and allows moisture in!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give ZERO stars!!! Camera was used once in water and leaked. Company would not replace camera and had us send it in under warranty. They returned it to us saying it was repaired. Used in water once and again water got inside lens. Sent in for 2nd warranty repair and camera was returned saying they repaired and once again moisture got in lens after 1 use in water. Use in water is within 1 ft and short period of time. Extremely disappointed as it continues costing us money to ship for warranty repair and Olympus Is doing nothing!
customer_reviews.author: HighspringsMom

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, Tilting screen makes it easier to see ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, Tilting screen makes it easier to see in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Porterjebazillanator

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Repair - NOT
customer_reviews.text: Returned my camera for a recall/warranty repair. It was returned un-repaired due to tamper. We have only used this camera a few times and works great. So I don't know why the repair was not performed when they sent me a request to fix the issue with an o-ring. They did offer a 20 percent discount on a new camera. Mine is not even 6 months old and they want me to buy another. Why would I buy new if I know how they handle their warranty and recall claims. Buy another brand look st Nikon or Canon. They have some of the top rated heavy duty point and shoot cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect point and shoot for adventurers.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camera. Nice wide lens. So fun to use underwater!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it takes awesome photos and great underwater shots
customer_reviews.text: I only wish there was a lens cover. I'm worried about it being scratched since we use it a lot at the beach. Aside from that, it takes awesome photos and great underwater shots!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie DV

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera, worked better than expected. Took great video and pictures on land and under water. Highly recommend this camera for all your photo needs.
customer_reviews.author: RKS

customer_reviews.title: Quite a handful of Fun!
customer_reviews.text: The size is just right. The photos are excellent. The videos with audio are superb. All this at a very decent price.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer jordan

customer_reviews.title: BEST, BEST
customer_reviews.text: BEST, BEST, BEST CAMERA - I have personally recommended this to several friends and family, people would stop me on vacation to ask what kind of camera it was... Waterproof, drop proof...
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: A super camera!
customer_reviews.text: A super camera !! Great picture under water and your screen can move and you can take a selfie and see yourself the image in the exact moment in that you do It.
customer_reviews.author: Érika Regina da Silva Martinho

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great product, extremely responsive camera and great picture under water etc....
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: it's very cool. i've put it under water
customer_reviews.text: i got the camera $199, it's very cool. i've put it under water, it's working as usual. i really love it. i can take it with me, when i play in the water.i take some pictures, looks very great.
customer_reviews.author: hufan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The person the camera was given to absolutely loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Nowatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Our company purchases these for use in industrial environments and ...
customer_reviews.text: Our company purchases these for use in industrial environments and we have certainly found them to be durable and quality cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Creek

customer_reviews.title: Display died suddenly
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a while. One fine day, without any warning, the LCD died.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard R Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a waterproof camera for a trip to the Galapagos. After doing some research we decided to go with the new TG-850. It took great pictures until on day 2 we took it in the water. Despite following all the instructions the camera evidently leaked and the electronics went haywire. Thank goodness we had a backup camera (Canon). Now waiting for Olympus to tell us what to do as their webpage does not yet include support information the TG-850. I have owned Olympus equipment in the past and it worked well. Unfortunately this was a major disappointment especially on a trip where underwater photos would have really been special.
customer_reviews.author: Foremore

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Best durable camera on the market. The wide angle lens really picks up a lot more than most cameras. The only things that would make this camera better would be built in WiFi and the screen to be on a pivot hing to the side to allow for more viewing angles (but the screen hing is great for Selfies)
customer_reviews.author: Mattleo86

customer_reviews.title: No memory stick
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that there was no memory stick included with the new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: It took great photos. However
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I got this camera for some snorkeling photos on our honeymoon. It took great photos. However, after one day of use the camera's different functions ceased to work. We could no long take video or review our photographs. It would still take photos above and below water. When we got home and contact Olympus about the issue they wanted us to send them approximately half the value of the camera to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for active people!!!! we think about ordering some more for fieldwork!
customer_reviews.author: ml

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 850 for my trip to Mexico that involved a lot of beach/snorkling. I am writing this review in the middle of my vacation to say that all the buttons except the shutter and the power button is non fuctional. I am stuck with the rest of my vacation shooting in a program auto mode with no zoom or scene setting. Awesome. update: after posting this review, the next day the camera completely failed on me. Needless to say, I will never buy an olympus camera.
customer_reviews.author: slsak

customer_reviews.title: Fast operation, super wide 21mm lens, amazing macro, useful flip screen
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: There's a recall for the first batch of TG850s for a poor, potentially leaking seal around the function dial. I just sent mine back for free warranty repair. Hopefully that would take care of the other reviewers' sudden camera fails. ----------- Great little camera. Starts up and operates super fast. The 21mm super wide lens is great for landscapes. The flip screen makes perfect group selfies a snap. Macro shoots down to 1cm, and brings out tons of detail. The in-camera battery charging that requires it's own non-standard adapter is kind of a pain - I prefer the external chargers. Best non-GPS / non-WiFi waterproof camera out there, with some unique features.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this, havent had a chance to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this, havent had a chance to use it underwater yet. The camera takes great, quality photos. I love the flip up screen, very usefull for when you dont have anyone else to take a picture of the group.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible pictures! I tried in different lighting, conditions, places........nothing worked. Everything was blurry.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. It was easy for him to use
customer_reviews.author: Frances I. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great product but thought it was bundled with a floating ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product but thought it was bundled with a floating strap. No floating strap and no response to my seller feedback about that.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. MacCracken

customer_reviews.title: had to return
customer_reviews.text: unit when into a deflault setting, could only take wide angle photo's, returned for refund. When it worked I had great photo's
customer_reviews.author: carl shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Kaput after first conact with sea water - I would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very nice concept with the screen. We are in Egypt right now. Camera went out of order after first snorkeling. It seems to be the buttons. The battery compartment is dry. Camera was still working (No zoom, no menus, but on /off ok andalso taking pictures). After third snorkeling trip no reaction any more. A total desaster. Seems to be very bad engineering or production. I can not recomend this camera because now I am at the red sea and can not take pictures in the water. Luckily I have another normal camera with me for pictures at the rest of the day. Chance that I recommend it to friends: 0% Chance that I buy another Olympus: 0%
customer_reviews.author: Der Micha

customer_reviews.title: Check for defects and misleads
customer_reviews.text: This camera was great when it worked. As for saying its water and shock resistant to a certain point that's bogus. Water resistant up to 33 meter?! I was in 1 meter of water and this thing quit on me. Haven't even had it for 6 months
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Trinh

customer_reviews.title: broke on first snorkeling day
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for trip to Hawaii for snorkeling photos. First time out all the buttons stopped working except power and shutter- same as the other review here. The camera was only 2 feet under water. When I opened the battery compartment, I found a drop of water. The gasket was clean and the door locked closed but water got in and destroyed the camera.
customer_reviews.author: David Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: First one didn't work so reordered another one. we Will see if this one turns on.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Warner

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I only use it for 2times(about 30min.) but it broken,I need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Yang R.

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely the worst camera I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: My first review! This is absolutely the worst camera I have ever used. The pics are terrible. I even had it replaced 3 times because I thought I got a dud. Nope. Just a piece of junk. I would not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Salsberry

customer_reviews.title: Did Olympus even test this item before going market, or was that our job?
customer_reviews.text: Defective product. Stopped working properly upon first use. Fortunately I had a trusty Panasonic in tow for my underwater shots. Otherwise would have ruined my snorkeling experience and vacation. Olympus is now offering repairs along with the three ring circus in order to get your shipping costs refunded. Of course they are not replacing the item nor providing prepaid labels for everyone's inconveniences and ruined product. That would actually entail having good customer service. My fault and everyone else here I guess for trying something different and unproven. Back to the real underwater digital brands. Fool me once...
customer_reviews.author: Dick

customer_reviews.title: When I got his camera it looked like the package had been opened and when I turned ...
customer_reviews.text: When I got his camera it looked like the package had been opened and when I turned on the camera it had 3 photo saved to the camera of a person and his house. It sketched me out so I am taking it back and getting a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mcneely

customer_reviews.title: nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Just received, looks great. very convenient and nice look. I will come back to update the product. a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Zhongqiang Mao

product_meta.title: Olympus Stylus TG-850 IHS 16 MP Digital Camera (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:BaseA secluded beach. A trip to the zoo. The kids trying out new snowboards. Active lifestyles generate great photo ops - and there"s no better camera for capturing these special moments than the new TG-850. It"s super-rugged and waterproof, yet stylish enough for less "extreme" pursuits - like documenting your daughter"s first lacrosse goal. The TG-850 has a super-sharp wide-angle lens, a 180-degree swivel LCD monitor (selfie alert!) and high-def video capability. Quite simply, it"s a terrific all-around camera.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 



A WHOLE NEW ANGLE ON TOUGH.
A secluded beach. A trip to the zoo. The kids trying out new snowboards. Active lifestyles generate great photo ops – and there’s no better camera for capturing these special moments than the new TG-850. It’s super-rugged and waterproof, yet stylish enough for less “extreme” pursuits – like documenting your daughter’s first lacrosse goal. The TG-850 has a super-sharp wide-angle lens, a 180-degree swivel LCD monitor (selfie alert!) and high-def video capability. Quite simply, it’s a terrific all-around camera.

Waterproof, Shockproof, Crushproof, Freezeproof* – Let’s Just Say It’s “Lifeproof”
Conditions can be a little rough when you live life outside. That’s why we engineered the TG-850 to be a very tough outdoor camera. Waterproof (to 33ft/10m), shockproof (to 7ft/2.1m), crushproof (to 220lbf/100kgf) and freezeproof (to 14°F/-10°C), the TG-850 is built to operate flawlessly in extreme conditions – which means you won’t have to worry about a little rain during a bike ride in the local park.

*When flip LCD is closed


The World’s First Rugged Camera with a Swivel LCD
A tilting LCD monitor makes it much easier to do things like taking shots from strange angles. But a 180-degree swivel monitor on a waterproof camera like the TG-850 also lets you shoot cool half-in-the-water shots of fish swimming by under a bright blue sky, or your goofy friend Mark pretending to be a fish. It also makes taking really good selfies a snap; in fact, if you mount it on your surfboard or mountain bike, you can find out what your “action face” looks like!

The Widest Lens of Any Rugged Camera
The TG-850’s super-wide 21mm (equivalent) lens captures 25% more of whatever you’re shooting than the 28mm versions on other rugged cameras. Your images will be more panoramic, and you don’t have to move backward to capture more of the scene – particularly useful when you’re standing on a cliff! You can also fit more friends into the selfies and group shots you’ll undoubtedly be taking to preserve the memories of your outdoor adventures.

On Top of Everything Else…Pro-quality Video
Mountable video cameras are great for, well, video – but they’re limited when it comes to still photography. The TG-850, on the other hand, offers the wide-ranging functionality of a robust digital camera and the ability to shoot full HD 60p video, twice as fast as standard 1080/30p. You get professional quality footage with amazing clarity that smoothly plays back fast action – and you can apply many of the same Art Filters found on Olympus’s more expensive cameras to achieve unusual effects.

Capture a Series of Photos with Timed Interval Shooting
Videos are obviously a great way to capture live action. But sometimes you want a series of dramatic stills instead. The TG-850’s interval shooting feature allows you to do just that. Shorter intervals are great for capturing each step of an action sequence, or you can set the camera for longer intervals and stitch the images together into a time-lapse movie (software required). You can even mount the camera on your bike or helmet for hands-free convenience.

Express Your Creativity with Art Filters
In case the unadulterated beauty of the great outdoors isn’t enough for you, the TG-850 offers an unmatched array of creative tools to enhance your photos and videos. Art Filters like Grainy Film, Pin Hole and Soft Focus can be applied right in the camera; no need to download your images to a computer for manipulation. You can also experiment with fun Magic Filters like Fisheye, Sparkle and Reflection, and Picture Filters – including Vivid, Muted and Monotone – that modify color saturation.

Olympus iHS Technology – Faster and Smarter
Combine a newly developed, powerful DSLR-quality image processor (TruePic™ VII) and a best-in-class BSI CMOS sensor, and you’ve got a camera that provides blazing fast autofocus, superb low-light performance and accurate subject and scene recognition (thanks to the enhanced iAUTO feature). It adds up to iHS – Intelligent, High Sensitivity, High Speed – and the TG-850 has it, offering dramatically improved image quality from a camera you can take to the ends of the earth – or to the pool party down the street.

Keep It Sharp with Dual Image Stabilization
Maybe your target – say, your friend Rachel trying out her new kayak – is flashing in and out of frame as she navigates the rapids. Maybe your hands are a little shaky after a sleepless night at the campsite. No worries…the TG-850’s sensor-shift image stabilization system, high ISO sensitivity and blink-of-an-eye shutter speeds work together seamlessly, enabling you to capture crisp, clear images even if the subject (or your camera) are moving.
feature_bullets: Tough performance; shockproof to 7 feet, waterproof to 33 feet; crushproof to 220 lbs, freezeproof to 14 degrees F
Newly developed 21mm (equiv.), 5X zoom lens, the widest in the compact camera class
The first Tough series camera equipped with a tilt LCD screen
